intro: Dipcadi welwitschii, commonly known as the Welwitsch's onion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its bulbous stem and strap-like leaves. The plant produces clusters of white or pale pink flowers during the summer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is often cultivated in gardens.
